current instance to service

onCreate

See Also:
Service

onDestroy

public void onDestroy()
Called when service is destroyed, e.g., by stopService() Here, we tear down all recording threads, close all handlers, unregister receivers for battery signal and close the thread for indicating the recording

See Also:
Service

onStartCommand

public int onStartCommand(Intent intent,
                          int flags,
                          int startId)
Called when startService() is invoked by other parts of AIRS (AIRS_record_tab as well as AIRS_shortcut) The sequence of calling this appropriately (be careful to not change this) 1. startService() 2. bindService() 3. set start = true and call startService() again 4. service.Discover() -> sets discovered == true 5. startService() again for measurements

Parameters:
intent - Reference to the calling Intent
flags - Flags set by the caller
startId - ID created per calling of the service (identifying the caller)
See Also:
AIRS_shortcut, AIRS_record_tab
